# wutims.com

> Small blog about AI development and general thoughts about life. I also love teaching people about table tennis and talking about food.

This is Tim Wu's personal site documenting his journey through AI development, software engineering, and life in general.

## About the Author

Tim Wu is a software developer based in the US with interests in:
- AI development and tooling
- Web development (React, TypeScript, TanStack)
- Table tennis (teaching and playing)
- Food (cooking, eating, and talking about it)
- Whiskey appreciation (sherry cask finished and Islays)

## Site Sections

### Blog (/blog)
Technical posts about AI development, software engineering, and personal reflections on technology.

### Projects (/blog)
Open source projects and experiments, including:
- **Glutton**: A RAG backend system for document ingestion and semantic search, built with hexagonal architecture

### About (/about)
Personal background and journey from New Jersey to North Carolina, interests in table tennis, cooking, and technology.

### Component Library (/components)
A showcase of the site's design system built with TanStack Start, Tailwind CSS, and CVA (Class Variance Authority).

## Technical Stack

This site is built with:
- TanStack Start (React meta-framework)
- TanStack Router (type-safe routing)
- Tailwind CSS
- Content Collections (MDX/Markdown processing)
- Framer Motion (animations)
- Deployed on Cloudflare Pages

## Contact

- GitHub: https://github.com/wuTims
- LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/timlwu

## Content Guidelines

All blog posts and project documentation are original content. The site focuses on:
- Learning in public
- Practical AI development insights
- Software engineering best practices
- Personal growth and productivity

## Licensing

Blog content is available for reference and learning. Code snippets in posts are typically MIT licensed unless otherwise specified.
